metadata.Title: CVE-2015-1283 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
Multiple integer overflows in the XML_GetBuffer function in Expat through2.1.0, as used in Google Chrome before 44.0.2403.89 and other products,allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service (heap-based bufferoverflow) or possibly have unspecified other impact via crafted XML data, arelated issue to CVE-2015-2716.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-1283` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 44.0.2403.89-0ubuntu1.1195
chromium-browser-l10n - 44.0.2403.89-0ubuntu1.1195
chromium-chromedriver - 44.0.2403.89-0ubuntu1.1195
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 44.0.2403.89-0ubuntu1.1195
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 44.0.2403.89-0ubuntu1.1195
No subscription required

expat - 2.1.0-7
lib64expat1 - 2.1.0-7
libexpat1 - 2.1.0-7
No subscription required

libxmltok1 - 1.2-4ubuntu0.18.04.1~esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '44.0.2403.89-0ubuntu1.1195').
expat package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.1.0-7').
xmlrpc-c package in esm-apps/bionic is affected and needs fixing.
vnc4 package in esm-apps/bionic is affected and needs fixing.
swish-e package in esm-apps/bionic is affected and needs fixing.
cadaver package in esm-apps/bionic is affected and needs fixing.
coin3 package in esm-apps/bionic is affected and needs fixing.
matanza package in esm-apps/bionic is affected and needs fixing.
libxmltok package in esm-apps/bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.2-4ubuntu0.18.04.1~esm1').
